_comment: SAMPLE ROW TEMPLATE - Please fill in with actual (redacted) data
_instructions: Save this as a CSV with columns: idx, note, full_note, conversation, summary_json
note: Patient presents with left arm pain after fall 3 months ago. Reports worsening symptoms and reduced ROM.
full_note:
HISTORY: 65-year-old female with history of Parkinson's disease on olanzapine, presented with chief complaint of left arm pain following a fall 3 months prior. Patient reports progressive worsening of pain, now radiating to shoulder. Associated symptoms include difficulty raising arm above head, decreased grip strength. No numbness or tingling reported.

MEDICATIONS: Olanzapine 5mg daily (recently discontinued due to rigidity), Carbidopa-levodopa 25-100 TID.

PHYSICAL EXAM: Left shoulder with limited abduction (60 degrees vs 180 normal), tenderness over rotator cuff insertion. No visible deformity. Neck shows mild rigidity, improved since olanzapine discontinuation.

ASSESSMENT: Rotator cuff injury vs frozen shoulder, likely exacerbated by fall. Medication-induced rigidity improving.
conversation:
Patient: I fell about 3 months ago and hurt my left arm. It's been getting worse.
Doctor: Can you describe the pain? Where exactly does it hurt?
Patient: It's mainly in my shoulder area, but sometimes goes down my arm. I can't lift my arm up like I used to.
Doctor: On a scale of 1-10, how would you rate the pain?
Patient: About a 6 or 7, worse when I try to reach for things.
Doctor: Have you had any numbness or tingling?
Patient: No, just the pain and stiffness.
Doctor: I see you were on olanzapine. How has your neck stiffness been since stopping it?
Patient: Much better actually. The neck feels less rigid now.
summary_json: {"chief_complaint": "left arm pain after fall", "duration": "3 months", "severity": "6-7/10", "location": "left shoulder radiating to arm", "aggravating_factors": ["reaching", "lifting"], "associated_symptoms": ["reduced ROM", "weakness"], "negatives": ["no numbness", "no tingling"], "past_medical_history": ["Parkinson's disease"], "medications": {"current": ["Carbidopa-levodopa 25-100 TID"], "discontinued": ["Olanzapine 5mg - due to rigidity"]}, "physical_exam": {"left_shoulder": {"abduction": "60 degrees (limited)", "tenderness": "rotator cuff insertion"}, "neck": "mild rigidity, improved"}, "assessment": ["Rotator cuff injury vs frozen shoulder", "Drug-induced rigidity (improving)"], "plan": ["Consider imaging", "Physical therapy referral", "Follow-up in 2 weeks"]}
